title: Biden’s First Supreme Court Vacancy: A Look at Potential Candidates to Replace Breyer
sub_head: The president has previously pledged to place the first Black woman on the high court
body:
Justice Stephen Breyer’s coming retirement gives President Biden his first opportunity to fill a seat on the solidly conservative Supreme Court. His administration hasn’t made public any list of potential contenders, but the Democratic president has previously pledged to put the first Black woman on the high court. Here are some potential candidates for his shortlist:
Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, 51, joined the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit in June after being confirmed by the Senate by a 53-44 vote, mostly along party lines.
